meanings.sent1: She had to upstep onto the chair to reach the top shelf.
meanings.sent2: He always upsteps carefully when climbing the stairs.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to upstep onto the table but failed comically.
meanings.sent4: Her confidence upstepped as she conquered her fear of heights.
meanings.sent5: The sun seemed to upstep higher in the sky with each passing hour.

meanings.definition: An upward movement or increase in level or quality.
meanings.sent1: The upstep in sales was a welcome surprise for the company.
meanings.sent2: The mountain climber felt a sense of achievement with each upstep.
meanings.sent3: The sudden upstep in temperature caught everyone off guard.
meanings.sent4: The upstep in technology has revolutionized the way we communicate.
meanings.sent5: The upstep in her performance was evident to all who watched.
